title: Think where man's glory most begins and ends, and say my glory was I had such friends.
author: William Butler Yeats

title: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funny bone.
author: Reba McEntire

title: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: I say luck is when an opportunity comes along and you're prepared for it.
author: Denzel Washington

title: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.
author: John Boyle O'Reilly

title: You've got to think lucky. If you fall into a mudhole, check your back pocket - you might have caught a fish.
author: Darrell Royal

title: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.
author: George William Russell

title: Christ beside me, Christ before me, Christ behind me, Christ within me, Christ beneath me, Christ above me.
author: Saint Patrick

title: Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.
author: Joseph Brodsky

title: Being Irish, he had an abiding sense of tragedy, which sustained him through temporary periods of joy.
author: William Butler Yeats

title: You gotta try your luck at least once a day, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.
author: Jimmy Dean

title: I love everything that's old, - old friends, old times, old manners, old books, old wine.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

title: I try to be grateful for the abundance of the blessings that I have, for the journey that I'm on and to relish each day as a gift.
author: James McGreevey

title: There is no language like the Irish for soothing and quieting.
author: John Millington Synge

title: Fond memory brings the light of other days around me.
author: Thomas Moore

title: Luck is believing you're lucky.
author: Tennessee Williams

title: Above all else, deep in my soul, I'm a tough Irishwoman.
author: Maureen O'Hara

title: If it was raining soup, the Irish would go out with forks.
author: Brendan Behan

title: We have always found the Irish a bit odd. They refuse to be English.
author: Winston Churchill

title: Love is never defeated, and I could add, the history of Ireland proves it.
author: Pope John Paul II

title: Being Irish, I always had this love of words.
author: Kenneth Branagh

title: If you're Irish, it doesn't matter where you go - you'll find family.
author: Victoria Smurfit

title: I come from an Irish Catholic family, and hell-raising is part of the DNA.
author: Brian Dennehy

title: That's what the holidays are for - for one person to tell the stories and another to dispute them. Isn't that the Irish way?
author: Lara Flynn Boyle

title: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.
author: Socrates

title: I was raised in a very old fashioned Ireland where women were reared to be lovely.
author: Anne Enright

title: Every St. Patrick's Day every Irishman goes out to find another Irishman to make a speech to.
author: Shane Leslie

title: Geographically, Ireland is a medium-sized rural island that is slowly but steadily being consumed by sheep.
author: Dave Barry

title: Being Irish is very much a part of who I am. I take it everywhere with me.
author: Colin Farrell
